author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In lands afar where conflict roars, 'tis Israel that strikes,
Near targets of Hezbollah, where danger ever hikes.
A salvo sharp, a prelude grim, 'gainst war's eternal lore,
In Lebanon, the tale unfolds, where peace is oft unsure.

Across the sea, in shipyard vast, in arm's embrace we find,
South Korea with craft and court, its prowess yet unlined.
Yet, Yankish ships by law's decree, their birthplace not to be here,
Prepare for a contest grim, 'neath China's shadowing leer.

Now in Pakistan's fraught realm, a sportsman holds the reign,
Imprisoned he may be, yet influences remain.
He defies the army's will, for democracy's endearing song,
A tabloid fixture, a star, his path both brave and long.

feedItems.title: Israel Calls On Civilians Near Hezbollah Targets to Evacuate as Strikes Intensify
feedItems.description: The Israeli military launched a series of airstrikes in Lebanon in what it said was a pre-emptive strike targeting Hezbollah’s military infrastructure.

feedItems.title: At the World's Largest Shipyard, U.S. Courts an Ally to Face Up to China
feedItems.description: South Korea offers shipbuilding capacity, know-how and talent that rivals China, but American ships by law must be built in the U.S.

feedItems.title: The Sports Star and Tabloid Fixture Staring Down Pakistan's Army
feedItems.description: From jail, former Prime Minister Imran Khan still makes decisions big and small for the party he built. He tells the Journal he’s battling for democracy.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
To Russian and the Yankee Right,
A common cause doth stir their might;
'Gainst vows of love that dare not speak,
In Afric's heart, swift death they seek.

From Israel, and Lebanon's home,
The hawks and crows in night skies roam,
At Iron Dome they ply their craft,
And leave but smoke on morning's draft.

Al Jazeera, in the West Bank's palm,
Yet suffers by the soldier's arm,
The news cut short, the scribes expelled,
In silence, truths remain withheld.

feedItems.title: Russia and U.S. Religious Conservatives See Common Foe in Africa: Gay Rights
feedItems.description: Unlikely coalition provides moral support for local activists pushing laws criminalizing homosexuality; death penalty in Uganda.

feedItems.title: Israel and Hezbollah Slide Toward Full-Scale War in Night of Intense Strikes
feedItems.description: The militant group said it targeted an air base and a developer of Israel’s Iron Dome system, while dozens of Israeli warplanes struck southern Lebanon.

feedItems.title: Israeli Military Raids and Shuts Al Jazeera's West Bank Bureau
feedItems.description: Troops entered the news outlet’s Ramallah office during a live broadcast and ordered staff out.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
On Biden's envoy, wise as a snail, 
Decisions delicate as rabbit's trail.
An accord in his grasp, a career lost in gale,
Under hound's eye, his deeds pale in detail.

Upon Snake Island, Ukraine's hearty core,
An ashen goat 'midst the battle's roar.
Rare eyes cast upon its quaint shore,
Challenges the bear's might, the eagle's lore.

Israel's cry, a petulant dog's demand,
To the Lebanon's serpent neath desert sand.
Rumble of war, a chaotic band,
Or a back turned, drawn line in the sand.

feedItems.title: Biden's Iran Envoy Wanted a Nuclear Deal. It May Have Cost Him His Career.
feedItems.description: Robert Malley, who was known for engaging adversaries and pushing the envelope on diplomacy, is under FBI investigation.

feedItems.title: On Ukraine's Snake Island, the Heart of the Battle for the Black Sea
feedItems.description: The Wall Street Journal was granted rare access to the island, which has been at the center of Ukraine’s efforts to challenge Russian power in the area.

feedItems.title: Israel's Ultimatum to Hezbollah: Back Off or Go to War
feedItems.description: A strategy shift includes escalating attacks aimed at forcing the militant group from the Lebanon-Israel border.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Beirut's heart, where cypress trees once stood,
Lebanon's sons felt Odin's wrath unfold.
Sixteen elite, to Valhalla sent, forsooth,
By thunder's strike and the fury of the bold.

To the west, where rooster's first light appears,
A shift of power in the land of wine.
Despite the losses, the Macron's peers 
Still hold the shield, in sunlit line.

In Darfur land, where the desert meets the sky,
Siege descends, as bitter as the cold.
Under Thor's relentless eye,
A famine's tale, grim and old.

feedItems.title: Israeli Strike Decimates Hezbollah Military Leadership
feedItems.description: The militant group said 16 of its elite members were killed in Friday’s attack in Beirut, which Lebanon’s health minister said left a total of 37 people dead.

feedItems.title: France's New Prime Minister Forms His Government, Shifting Rightward
feedItems.description: The new cabinet remains largely dominated by ministers from the ranks of President Emmanuel Macron despite his party’s heavy losses in recent parliamentary elections.

feedItems.title: Siege in Darfur Spirals Into a Brutal Battle for Control
feedItems.description: An all-out assault of shelling and airstrikes on densely populated areas is exacerbating a famine crisis in Sudan’s El Fasher.
